articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Mirim Riding Club
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Mirim Riding Club
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the construction site of the Mirim Riding Club.
					 After being briefed on the Mirim Riding Club in front of its master plan, he acquainted himself in detail with the progress made in the construction.
					
					 He was very satisfied to learn that the soldier-builders have done a lot of work in a brief span of time by overcoming bottlenecks and difficulties in the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 He said that the appearance of the modern Mirim Riding Club would help working people and school youth and children enjoy horse riding there to have sound mentality and strong physical bodies for labor and national defence.
					
					 He set forth tasks to be fulfilled to build the club at a world level.
					
					 He stressed the need to build well a room for preserving historic relics to convey the exploits performed by leader Kim Jong Il in guiding the club and construct indoor riding exercise hall, riding school, service building and other structures to be impeccable even in the distant future. 
					
					 He told officials to build modern recovery facilities where visitors may recover from fatigue after riding.
					
					  A veterinary hospital and a stockbreeding research institute should be built in order to take good care of horses and increase the number of their head, he noted, adding:
					
					 It is also necessary to take steps for successfully operating the club in a far-sighted manner while accelerating the construction of the club.
					
					 It is important to properly choose a unit for operating the club, organize a horse riders association and scrupulously do a work for providing things such as vehicles, lawn mowers and sprinkler trucks necessary for the management and operation of the club, he added.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the soldier-builders and officials concerned would successfully complete the club till the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Ma Won Chun and Kim Su Gil.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Munsu Wading Pool
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Construction Site of Munsu Wading Pool
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the construction site of the Munsu Wading Pool.
					 After being briefed on the wading pool before a map showing its bird's-eye view, he went round its different places.
					
					 At the indoor wading pool, he watched its lobby with keen interest, giving a precious instruction on making sure that a statue of leader Kim Jong Il is erected with good care.
					
					 The completion of the wading pool would mean carrying out the behest of Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul to provide a comprehensive wading pool to the people, he said, adding how nice it would be if it were built in the lifetime of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He was satisfied to learn that the roof of the wading pool is made with ball truss to suit the nature of the multi-service indoor wading pool and covered with glass to admit sunrays.
					
					 On the first floor of the inner wading pool he commanded a bird's-eye view of the outdoor wading pool with latest wading water tanks. When the pool is completed and furnished with the latest wading amusement facilities, it will look very nice and fantastic, he noted.
					
					 The Munsu Wading Pool will operate as a multi-service sports centre when the rooftop of the indoor wading pool will have volleyball, badminton and basketball courts, and skate park, sand volleyball court and other sports and amusement facilities will appear around the outdoor wading pool, he said.
					
					 The Munsu Wading Pool will be crowded with people and school youth and children in the future, he said, noting everyone feels pleasant when thinking of this.
					
					 He praised the builders for taking measures for using terrestrial heat so as to consume electricity as less as possible.
					
					 He underlined the need to plant trees of good species in the area of the outdoor wading pool to suite environment, and create larger area of turf.
					
					 It is the determination and will of the Workers' Party of Korea to successfully complete the Munsu Wading Pool as a world class one and provide the people with it till the anniversary of the Party founding, he said.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the soldier-builders would unconditionally finish the construction of the Munsu Wading Pool as scheduled and materialize the plan of the WPK in revolutionary practice.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Ma Won Chun and Kim Su Gil.

articles.title: Greetings to Singaporean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Singaporean President
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greeting to Tony Tan Keng Yam, president of the Republic of Singapore, on its national day.
					 The message wished the Republic of Singapore steady development and prosperity.
					
					 It expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK Party, Government Delegation Returns from Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK Party, Government Delegation Returns from Equatorial Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK party and government delegation headed by Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, returned home on Friday after visiting Equatorial Guinea.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice Department Director of the C.C., WPK Pak Kun Gwang and charge d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy here Tian Baozhen.

articles.title: Kaesong Youth Stadium Remodeled in DPRK
articles.content:
Kaesong Youth Stadium Remodeled in DPRK
						
 Kaesong, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Kaesong Youth Stadium has been remodeled in the DPRK.
					 The builders tamped the football ground and planted turf of new species there. They also rebuilt on an expansion basis the grounds for volleyball, basketball and table-tennis as well as training rooms and lobbies for players.
					
					 They face-lifted the auditorium and other buildings. 100 m indoor and 400 m outdoor courses were newly paved for athletic matches.
					
					 Saunas, public baths and a soft drink stand have sprung up along with an outdoor swimming pool of peculiar style.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Football School
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Football School
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang International Football School was opened as a center for training reserve footballers.
					 In this regard, KCNA had an interview with Myong Hyong Sun, deputy principal of the school.
					
					 Question: Can you tell me about the education system of the school?
					
					 Answer: The school has now an enrollment of more than 100 boys and girls.
					
					 It is planning to recruit hundreds of children in the future.
					
					 Its educational system breaks into the five-year primary school, three-year junior secondary school and three-year senior secondary school.
					
					 The subjects include football theory and training, computer, foreign languages and fundamental studies.
					
					 Selection of students is done by strict criteria.
					
					 Children with distinguished talents can enter the school anytime.
					
					 Q: Please tell me how the students' training is going on at the school.
					
					 A: Training takes place after class.
					
					 Most of its teachers are retired football aces and coaches recognized by the FIFA.
					
					 The school plans to invite foreign football experts and admit foreign children to it.
					
					 It is also going to send its enrollees abroad to learn football.
					
					 The school will steadily improve the methods of education in order to train a number of promising reserve footballers.

articles.title: Vitamin C Factory Goes Operational
articles.content:
Vitamin C Factory Goes Operational
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Vitamin C Factory has been commenced with due ceremony on Friday. It was built on the bank of the River Taedong in Pyongyang.
					 The vitamin C producing base has the latest production processes that use bioengineering methods.
					
					 The factory helps make another achievement in carrying out the behests of leader Kim Jong Il, who worked heart and soul to improve the standard of people's living, and will greatly contributing to promoting health of the people.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok and officials concerned, officials of different units, builders, youth shock brigade members and officials and employees of the factory.
					
					 Pak Sun Chol, general director of the Korean Taeyang General Company, made an address.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the factory.

articles.title: Wartime Song "At the Spring Site"
articles.content:
Wartime Song "At the Spring Site" 
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A wartime song "At the Spring Site" was put on stage as female quintet at the performance of the Moranbong Band which was given some days ago in honor of the participants in the military parade for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The song, vibrant with the feelings of unity between the army and the people, was created in Juche 41 (1952) when the Korean War (June 1950 -July 1953) was going on.
					
					 It was written by Choe Ro Sa, who was a military nurse at that time.
					
					 Choe was a student of Kim Il Sung University before joining the army.
					
					 One spring day in 1951, she went to a spring site of a rural village to prepare breakfast, while on a duty of evacuating wounded soldiers to the rear.
					
					 At the site, she saw some soldiers talking with girls doing their wash while singing songs.
					
					 She instantly took out a pen and wrote words for what she saw.
					
					 A year later, the song was composed by Yun Sung Jin, who was active at an art troupe.
					
					 The song became a hit, as it lively represented the kinship between servicepersons and civilians.
					
					 Soon it swept through the country, enjoying great popularity among the local people.

articles.title: June 15 Joint Declaration, Key to Settling National Issue: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
June 15 Joint Declaration, Key to Settling National Issue: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Only when the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are respected and implemented, is it possible to achieve trust and unity between the north and the south, improve the inter-Korean relations and bring about a bright future of independent reunification, peace and prosperity, says Rodong Sinmun in an article on Friday.
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the programme for implementing the former, are a key to improving the inter-Korean relations, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The declarations are the great programmes for reunification common to the nation as they were adopted at the north-south summits and solemnly made public before the world. They are the only guidelines for realizing reconciliation, unity and cooperation between the north and the south and developing the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Nothing can replace the declarations in improving the inter-Korean relations and meeting the vital demands and interests of all Koreans for independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities take sincere attitude with the firm will to improve the inter-Korean relations, these relations will turn into those of trust, reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					 If they truly want detente on the Korean Peninsula and the overhaul of the north-south ties, they should take the stand of "By our nation itself", not aligning with foreign forces and escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Unity, Cooperation Are Main Engine for Building New Independent Society: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Unity, Cooperation Are Main Engine for Building New Independent Society: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Unity and cooperation among developing countries have become a main trend of the times and they serve as a powerful engine for building a new independent world, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The way of increasing the national capabilities of developing countries is to strengthen unity and cooperation, the article says, adding: 
					
					 South-south cooperation has steadily developed by the common efforts exerted by developing countries.
					
					 These countries should make great efforts to expand the cooperation and exchange as demanded by the times and changed situation.
					
					 It is important to put international cooperation and exchange on a multilateral and diversified basis. 
					
					 Only then is it possible to develop the relations among countries widely and deeply and promote the development of the overall international relations.
					
					 It is necessary to settle disputes through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 It is also important to take coordinated actions on the international arena to defend the interests of developing countries. 
					
					 The might and viability of south-south cooperation will be fully demonstrated in the course of successfully realizing the common idea of developing countries.
					
					 Only when these countries defend the common interests by their united efforts, can they build a new peaceful, prosperous world.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Protest against Ruling Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Protest against Ruling Party
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A big group of south Korean marchers for reunification consisting of members of the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century staged an action in Kwangju on Tuesday in protest against the puppet ruling party obstructing the investigation into the case of the Intelligence Service's interference in the election.
					  The marchers held a rally outside the Kwangju City Building of the "Saenuri Party".
					
					 At the rally speakers termed the "Saenuri Party" the real chief culprit of the above-said case, adding that the present chief executive and Lee Myung Bak are responsible for the case.
					
					 They queried whether the ruling party is set to lend an ear to the voices of the people demanding a proper investigation into the truth about the case.
					
					 They called on the people to stage a candlelight action to protest against the "Saenuri Party" interrupting the state investigation into the case.
					
					 The participants in the rally chanted slogan "Dissolve the Saenuri Party!"
					
					 At the end of the rally its participants marched as far as Kumnam Route and conducted information activities in different parts of the city.
					
					 Then the group staged a candlelight action at Kumnam Route condemning the IS's interference in the election.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Saddled with Debts
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Saddled with Debts
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The plight of the south Korean students is getting serious day by day due to the unpopular rule of the "government" authorities.
					 According to the survey made by a relevant institution, one student of five is saddled with heavy debts owing to the fabulous amount of university registration fee.
					
					 It is reported that students are borrowing money at over 20 percent interest from banks or individuals in an effort to secure registration fee.
					
					 The miserable plight of south Korean students is an inevitable result produced by the traitorous politics of the puppet authorities indifferent to the people's living.

articles.title: Japan Hit for Reviving Militarism
articles.content:
Japan Hit for Reviving Militarism
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Segye Ilbo in an editorial on Wednesday condemned Japan for its ever-stepped moves to revive militarism.
					 The editorial recalled that the Japanese government is working to promote the official proposal to get permission for the use of the flag of aggression symbolic of militarism.
					
					 It branded this as another play with fire aimed to revive militarism.
					
					 Clear is the intention of Japan in its try to use again the flag of aggression, it said, adding: Lurking behind this is the aim to call back the departed soul of the militarists in order to legitimate the so-called "right to collective self-defense" capable of attacking other countries and retrogressively revise the Pacifist Constitution. It is also related to the issue of converting the "Self-Defense Forces" into a regular army.
					
					 The editorial lashed out at Japanese ultra-right media for joining the government in its move to revive militarism.
					
					 Does Japan have no other flag that can symbolize it, the editorial queried, noting: Intolerable is the wrong understanding of history by the Japanese ultra-right political forces who seek to officially use the flag of aggression.
					
					 Japanese Cabinet ministers are mulling visiting Yasukuni Shrine, where mortuary tablets of the war criminals are kept, on upcoming August 15, the day marking the defeat of Japanese militarism. Japan is even showing signs of revising and abrogating Kono statement and Murayama statement which admitted even a bit the history of aggression.
					
					 The behavior of the Japanese ruling quarters will bring shame to Japanese and their descendants.

articles.title: DPRK's Day of Victory in War Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Day of Victory in War Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries and regional organization carried special write-ups in the period between July 14 and 28 to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Special write-ups were posted on internet websites, magazines and newspaper with photos of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They included the internet websites of the Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front, Movement for Anti-Globalization, Moscow Workers' Union of Russia, Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea of Ukraine, internet magazines Remchichi and Mar 12 and internet newspaper Obektivnaya Gazeta.
					
					 The media carried articles titled "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", "Battle for liberation of Taejon" and "Miserable end of 'Ever-victorious Generals'" accompanied with photos showing popular heroism and matchless self-sacrificing spirit displayed by the army and people of the DPRK in the Fatherland Liberation War and documents dealing with brilliant results in battles.
					
					 The Communist Workers' Party of Russia under the Communist Party of the Soviet Union laid bare in its internet homepage the crimes committed by the U.S., the provoker of the Korean war, in an article titled "July 27 is the day of victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War."
					
					 Videos showing the parade and Pyongyang mass demonstration for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War were posted on the website.
					
					 The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its website an article and photos introducing the heroic struggle of the service personnel of the Korean People's Army during the war, illustrated with a portrait and photos of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The Anti-Imperialist Front of France posted an article titled "The great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War" on its website.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions carried on its website photos of Kim Il Sung and several articles titled "The peerless strategist" and "An event 60 years ago that shook the world".

articles.title: Zambian Businessmen Issue Statements to Mark DPRK's V-Day
articles.content:
Zambian Businessmen Issue Statements to Mark DPRK's V-Day
						
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Zambian businessmen issued statements on July 25 to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The director of a company of Zambia said it is the fruition of the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung that the Korean people won a great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The President, an invincible and iron-willed commander, will always be remembered by not only the Korean people but also all other progressive peoples of the world, he added.
					
					 The managing director of another Zambian company noted that the victory of the Korean people in the war inspired world progressives with the firm conviction of victory, hoping that only victory and glory would be in store for the Korean people in their efforts to achieve independence.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Singapur
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Singapur
						
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 9 un mensaje de felicitacion a Tony Tan Keng Yam, presidente de la Republica de Singapur con motivo de la fiesta nacional de este pais.
					El remitente felicita calurosamente al destinatario y su pueblo y hace votos por el desarrollo constante y la prosperidad de la republica de Singapur.
					
					Y expresa la conviccion de que se desarrollaran sin cesar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Reconstruido Estadio Juventud de Kaesong
articles.content:
Reconstruido Estadio Juventud de Kaesong
						
Pyongyang, 9 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo reconstruido en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea el Estadio Juventud de Kaesong.
					Los constructores realizaron el apisonamiento del suelo y la plantacion de cesped de nueva especie en el campo de futbol y reconstruyeron y ensancharon las canchas de voleibol, baloncesto, ping-pong y salas de entrenamiento y antesalas.
					
					Ademas fueron reconstruidos los asientos y varios edificios y formados nuevamente la pista de 100m bajo techo y la de 400m al aire libre.
					
					Se construyeron sauna, bano publico, refresco y la piscina al aire libre.
					
					Ahora numerosos deportistas, aficionados, trabajadores y jovenes y ninos escolares desarrollan dinamicamente varias actividades deportivas en este estadio.
